children.text: There has not been sufficient fall of 1:100 provided to the shower floor, which may result in water ponding, and eventually water leaking.
Part 3.8.1.2 of the Building Code of Australia (NCC/BCA) - Wet Areas, states that;
‘Building elements in wet areas within a building must-
be waterproof or water resistant in accordance with Table 3.8.1.1; and
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3740 Waterproofing of Domestic Wet Areas, in clause 3.4 Shower Floors, states that
‘For shower areas with a vertical separation between the shower area and the wet area, such as a shower screen, hob, step-down or water stop, the fall to the waste shall be 1:100’
The floor of this shower area will need to be re-constructed to have minimum 1:100 fall, and then be properly waterproofed in accordance with the BCA and AS 3740.
